text: Definition 3.4 (Derivation tree) Assume given a finite set R of transition rules and let A C R be the set of axioms. A derivation tree is a finite node-labelled tree whose nodes are labelled by transitions as follows. 1. All leaves are labelled by members of A 2. A node labelled by C has descendants labelled Py, ..., P, if there exists a transition rule in R of the form PP .
